User.title: User
User.description: Represents a user in the SmartLearn AI platform.

id.description: Unique identifier for the user entity.

progress.description: An array of topic IDs indicating the user's progress in each topic.

Topic.title: Topic
Topic.description: Represents a learning topic available on the platform.

id.description: Unique identifier for the topic entity.

createdBy.description: Reference to the User who created the topic. (Relationship: User 1:N Topic)

roadmap.description: An array of Roadmap IDs associated with this topic.

Roadmap.title: Roadmap
Roadmap.description: Represents a learning roadmap, which is a sequence of steps for a topic.

id.description: Unique identifier for the roadmap entity.

stepNumber.description: The step number in the roadmap sequence.

description.description: A description of what the step covers.

lessons.description: An array of Lesson IDs associated with this step.

Lesson.title: Lesson
Lesson.description: Represents a lesson within a learning step.

id.description: Unique identifier for the lesson entity.

description.description: A detailed description of the lesson.

youtubeLink.description: A link to a YouTube video associated with the lesson.

status.description: The status of the lesson (To Learn, Learning, Learned).

testId.description: Reference to the Test associated with this lesson. (Relationship: Lesson 1:1 Test)

Test.title: Test
Test.description: Represents a test or quiz associated with a lesson.

id.description: Unique identifier for the test entity.

lessonId.description: Reference to the Lesson this test belongs to. (Relationship: Lesson 1:1 Test)

questions.description: An array of questions in the test.

DailyTask.title: DailyTask
DailyTask.description: Represents a daily learning task assigned to a user.

id.description: Unique identifier for the daily task entity.

userId.description: Reference to the User assigned to this task. (Relationship: User 1:N DailyTask)

topicId.description: Reference to the Topic this task belongs to. (Relationship: Topic 1:N DailyTask)

lessonId.description: Reference to the Lesson associated with this task. (Relationship: Lesson 1:N DailyTask)

date.description: The date for which the task is assigned.

status.description: The status of the daily task.

Progress.title: Progress
Progress.description: Tracks a user's progress on a specific topic, including completed lessons and test scores.

id.description: Unique identifier for the progress entry.

completedLessons.description: A list of IDs of completed lessons.

testScores.description: A map of test IDs to scores.

definition.description: Stores user profiles, including name, email, and progress. It facilitates path-based ownership for user-specific data.
Stores learning topics, including title, creator, and associated roadmaps. Includes denormalized `createdBy` field for authorization independence.
Stores learning roadmaps associated with a specific topic, detailing the steps for each roadmap.
Stores lessons associated with a specific roadmap step, providing details like title, description, YouTube link, and status.
Stores tests associated with a specific lesson, including questions.
Stores daily tasks assigned to users, referencing the associated topic, lesson, and date.
Stores user progress for a specific topic.

firestore.reasoning: The Firestore structure is designed to support the SmartLearn AI platform, focusing on user-specific learning paths and AI-generated content. User data is stored under `/users/{userId}`, ensuring private user data. Topics are organized under `/topics/{topicId}`, each created by a specific user, establishing a clear ownership model. The roadmap, lessons, tests and daily tasks follow a similar pattern with hierarchical paths `/topics/{topicId}/roadmaps/{roadmapId}`, `/topics/{topicId}/roadmaps/{roadmapId}/lessons/{lessonId}`, `/lessons/{lessonId}/tests/{testId}`, and `/users/{userId}/tasks/{taskId}`. A separate `progress` collection tracks user progress per topic. This structure facilitates easy querying and management of learning resources associated with particular topics and users. The design allows for atomic operations on user-specific data and easy scaling as the platform grows. Crucially, Authorization Independence is achieved by storing the `createdBy` field in the `Topic` documents. This denormalization avoids the need for `get()` calls in security rules when determining authorization for reading or writing topics, roadmaps, lessons and tests.
